definition: to love/to be fond of/to like/affection/to be inclined (to do sth)/to tend to (happen)

sentences.english: The road to love is never smooth.
True love can take many forms.
For some, they finally find their one and only true love.
sentences.chinese: 对于一些人，他们最终会找到他们的另一半和真爱。

sentences.english: Only an act of true love can thaw a frozen heart.
sentences.chinese: 唯有真爱才能够融化冰冻的心。

sentences.english: The outcome ranges between a total disaster and a terrible heart ache to wonderful love stories that are pure, genuine, emotional-fulfilling and highly sexual.
sentences.chinese: 结果不外乎就是灾难心痛分手和灵欲合一的真爱之间。

sentences.english: So tell me have you ever really - really really ever loved a woman?
sentences.chinese: 那么现在，告诉我，你是否曾经正真爱上过一个女人？

sentences.english: If what you felt then was true love , then it's never too …
sentences.chinese: 如果那时你感受到是真爱，那就永远不会太迟。

sentences.english: Love left a position, a little less unnecessary doubts.
sentences.chinese: 给真爱留一个位置，少一点无谓的怀疑。

sentences.english: Help satisfy your thirst for season 4 by putting True Blood on your home screen.
sentences.chinese: 帮助满足您的主屏幕上把真爱如血第4季的渴求。

sentences.english: Strict national mind who is the only true love?
sentences.chinese: 严国心中唯一的真爱究竟是谁？

sentences.english: But to move on to the love you deserve, you have to make a commitment to stop obsessing.
sentences.chinese: 但为了得到你的真爱，你必须坚定信心停止这种迷恋。

sentences.english: Do not say the true love difficult look for but expel love are living in you outside.
sentences.chinese: 不要说真爱难寻而将爱排除于你生活之外。

sentences.english: I know what true love is.
Peace to you and the Lord loves you indeed.
sentences.chinese: 互道平安，说声主真爱你。

sentences.english: I had met the great love of my life . We dated a year.
sentences.chinese: 我遇到了“我一生的真爱”，我们相处了一年。

definition: emotion/sentiment/affection/feelings between two persons/CL:個|个[ge4],種|种[zhong3]
to love/to be fond of/to like/affection/to be inclined (to do sth)/to tend to (happen)
(to live together until the) white hairs of old age (idiom); to live to a ripe old age in conjugal bliss/until death do us part
love is more solid than gold (idiom)
(to live together until the) white hairs of old age (idiom); to live to a ripe old age in conjugal bliss/until death do us part
(romantic) love/CL:個|个[ge4],場|场[chang3]/in love/to have an affair
